test-method.name: verifySubstoreCounterSubModule
test-method.description: Precondition: User should be logged in and on the healthapp section 1. Login in the healthapp application 2. Scroll down menu till Substore 3. Click on the Substore4. SubStore module should be present

test-method.name: verifySubstoreSubModules
test-method.description: 1. Login in the healthapp application 2. Click on the substore 3. "Select your Substore" pop up 4. Expected value that should be present in "Select your Substore" modal Expected sub-modals button: Accounts,male ward SubStore,SubStore1,SubStore1

test-method.name: verifySubstoreModule
test-method.description: Precondition: User should be logged in and on the Verification section\n" + "1. Click on the Inventory Module + "2. Hover over on module signout button and get text3. Verify text To change, you can always click here.

test-method.name: verifySubstoreSubModule
test-method.description: Pre condition: User should be logged in and it is on SubStore module 1. Login in the healthapp application 2. Click on the Substore 3. "Select your Substore" pop up 4. Click on "Account" sub-modal 5. Click on the "Inventory" sub-module 6. Click on" Pharmacy" sub-module 7. All sub-modules should be displayed correctly. 8. Expected Sub modules are : Pharmacy, Inventory

test-method.name: verifyAllSubstoreModulesAreDisplayedInSublist
test-method.description: Pre condition: User should be logged in and it is on SubStore module 1. Click on the SubStore Module drop-down arrow 2. Click on Inventory module. Expected Sub modules are : Stock, Inventory Requisition, Consumption, Reports, Patient Consumption,Return

test-method.name: verifyNavigationBetweenSubmodules
test-method.description: Pre condition: User should be logged in 1. Click on the Substore Module drop-down arrow2. Verify navigation between sub-modules

test-method.name: takingScreenshotOfCurrentPage
test-method.description: Under Substore module > INventory Section" + "Take the screenshot of the current page

test-method.name: verifyInventoryRequisitionSection
test-method.description: Pre condition: User should be logged in and it is on SubStore module 1. Click on the SubStore module drop-down arrow 2. Click on Inventory sub-module 3. Click on Inventory Requisition section

test-method.name: verifyCreateRequisitionButton
test-method.description: Pre condition: User should be logged in and it is on Inventory sub-module 1. Click on "Inventory Requisition" section 2. Click on "Create Requisition" button 3. Click on "Target Inventory " field and Select "GENERAL-INVENTORY" option 4. Click on "Item Category" drop down and select " Consumables" option 5. Enter "tissue" in ItemName field 6. Enter the "Required Quantity" field 7. Click on "Request" button 8. Click on "Close" icon 9. Verify popup message Requisition is Generated and Saved

exception.message: expected [null] but found [Requisition is Generated and Saved]

test-method.name: verifyDateRangeFilterFunctionality
test-method.description: Pre condition: User should be logged in and it is on Inventory Sub-module 1. Navigate to "Inventory Requisition" section 2. Click on the "From" date and select the "Jan 2022" date 3. Click on the "To" date and Select "Current date" 4. Click on "OK" button 5. The 'Date' column date must fall within the selected date

test-method.name: VerifyDateRangeButton
test-method.description: Pre condition: User should be logged in and it is on Inventory sub-module > List Request section 1. Click on the data range button. 2. select "one week" option from the drop down.

test-method.name: verifyFilterByStoreFunctionality
test-method.description: Pre condition: User should be logged in and it is on Inventory sub-module 1. Navigate to "Inventory Requisition" section 2. Select option ar per the choice

test-method.name: verifyInventoryRequisitionRadioButtonSection
test-method.description: Pre condition: User should be logged in and it is on Inventory sub-module 1. Naviaget to "Inventory Requisition" section 2. Select "Pending" radio button 3. Select "Complete" radio button 4. Select "Canceled" radio button 5. Select "Withdrawn" radio button 6. Select "All" radio button 7. Ensure that all radio buttons in the "List by Requisition Status" field are functional and clickable.

test-method.name: verifyRecordsAreFilteredAccordingToSearchData
test-method.description: Pre condition: User should be logged in and it is on Inventory sub-module 1. Naviagte to the "Inventory Requisition" section 2. Click on "all" radio button 3. Enter the pending keyword in the search bar. 4. Record should be present as per the entered keyword

test-method.name: verifyPrintModalIsOpenedIfUserSelectsViewButton
test-method.description: Pre condition: User should be logged in and it is on Inventory sub-module > List Request section 1. Navigate to " Inventory Requisition" section 2. Click on "View" button of the specfic record. 3. Click on "Close" icon button 4. After Clicking "View" button, "REQUISITION DETAILS PRINT" page should pop up and by Clicking on close icon, user should navigate back to the Inventory Requisition page

test-method.name: verifyPendingRecordCanBeCopied
test-method.description: Pre condition: User should be logged in and it is on Inventory sub-module 1. Navigate to the "Inventory Requisition" section 2. Click on "..." drop down of the specfic record 3. Select "create copy" from drop down

test-method.name: verifyInventoryModule
test-method.description: Pre condition: User should be logged in 1. Navigate to the "Inventory" module 2. Navigate to "Internal" sub-module 3. Navigate to "Requisition" section 4. Click on "Direct Dispatch" button 5. Enter all the required field ( Store -> (it should match with current store of substore module), ItemCategory, ItemName , Dispatched Qty, Remark) 6. Click on the "Direct Dispatch" button 7. Click on "Close" icon 8. Navigate to "Substore" module and click on "Accounts" sub-modal 9. Navigate to "Inventory Requisition" section of "Inventory" sub-module 10. Click on "Receive item" of the specfic record 11. Click on the "Recevie" butotn 12. Click on "Back to Requisition List" button13. After clicking the "Receive" button, the remarks field should disappear, and a success message should appear: "Success: Items Received Successfully. Stock Updated."

test-method.name: verifyInventoryandStockModule
test-method.description: Pre condition: User should be logged in 1. Navigate to the "Inventory" module 2. Navigate to "Internal" sub-module 3. Navigate to "Requisition" section 4. Click on "Direct Dispatch" button 5. Enter all the required field ( Store -> (it should match with current store of substore module), ItemCategory, ItemName , Dispatched Qty, Remark) 6. Click on the "Direct Dispatch" button 7. Click on "Close" icon 8. Navigate to "Substore" module and click on "Accounts" sub-modal 9. Navigate to "Inventory Requisition" section of "Inventory" sub-module 10. Click on "Receive item" of the specfic record 11. Click on the "Recevie" butotn 12. Click on "Back to Requisition List" button 13. Navigate to the "Stock"section 14. Verify that the available quantity of items has increased in the stock.

test-method.name: verifyConsumptionCreationModule
test-method.description: Pre condition: User should be logged in and it is on Substore module 1. Naviagte to the "Consumption" section of the "Inventory" sub-module 2. Click on "New Consumption" 3. Enter all the required field (Consumption Date ,Item Name,Consumed Qty) 4. Click on "Save" button 5. Upon clicking the "Save" button, a success message saying "Consumption completed" should be displayed, and the data should be accurately reflected in the record.

test-method.name: verifyReportModule
test-method.description: Pre condition: User should be logged in and it is on Substore module 1. Naviagte to the "Reports" section of the "Inventory" sub-module 2. Navigate to "Consumption Report" sub-modal 3. Enter all the "From" and "To" field 4. Click on "Show Report" button 5. The 'Date' column data must align with the selected option from the dropdown, and it should display records added in the "Consumption" section for that specific date.

test-method.name: verifyReturnModuleErrorMessage
test-method.description: Pre condition: User should be logged in and it is on Inventory sub-module 1. Naviagte to the "Return" section 2. Click on "Return Items" buton 3. Click on "Return" button 4. After clicking the "Return" button, a error message stating "Please select inventory for return" should be displayed. Ensure that the entered data is visible in the "Return" section of the "Inventory" sub-module.

test-method.name: verifyGetPostById
test-method.description: Precondition: Access to JSONPlaceholder API 1. Send GET request to retrieve post by ID 2. Verify the response status code is 200 3. Validate the response body contains the expected post data

test-method.name: verifyAddPost
test-method.description: Precondition: Access to JSONPlaceholder API 1. Send POST request to create a new post 2. Verify the response status code is 201 3. Validate the response body contains the expected post data

test-method.name: verifyUpdatePost
test-method.description: Precondition: Access to JSONPlaceholder API 1. Send PUT request to update an existing post 2. Verify the response status code is 200 3. Validate the response body contains the updated post data

test-method.name: verifyDeletePost
test-method.description: Precondition: Access to JSONPlaceholder API 1. Send DELETE request to delete an existing post by ID 2. Verify the response status code is 200 or 204 3. Ensure the post is deleted by verifying a GET request returns 404

test-method.name: verifyGetCommentsForPost
test-method.description: Precondition: Access to JSONPlaceholder API 1. Send GET request to retrieve comments for a post by postId 2. Verify the response status code is 200 3. Validate that the response contains comments data
